title: Business & Finance
text:
Frigid temperatures across swaths of the U.S. injected new momentum into the rally in energy markets, boosting demand while threatening oil-and-gas production in Texas.

---

Several top U.S. business schools are skipping popular M.B.A. rankings this year, upending an annual rite for programs and prospective students.

---

The WTO chose as its first female leader ex-Nigerian Finance Minister Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala , as the organization seeks to revive its influence over global economic rules.

---

European banks are using the pandemic to slash jobs, shut branches and force customers online, changes investors have wanted for years.

---

Information in a shareholders lawsuit casts doubt on whether Boeing directors pressed management about 737 MAX safety problems before a second crash of the jet.

---

U.S. investigators are examining half a dozen accidents in which private Piper-built turboprop planes experienced steering difficulties on runways after landings.

---

Vivendi shares rose sharply after the company said it plans to distribute 60% of its UMG unit's capital to shareholders and spin off its profitable music label.
